channel.title: Enterprise Data Management on Natasha Smith Portfolio
channel.description: Recent content in Enterprise Data Management on Natasha Smith Portfolio

item.title: Part 1. Building a Data Warehouse: Technical Implementation and Challenges.
item.description:
View Project on GitHub:

Introduction

In today’s data-driven world, the ability to analyse large datasets and derive meaningful insights is a game-changer for businesses. One of the most important tools that helps achieve this goal is a Data Warehouse (DW).

In this blog post, I’ll walk through the technical journey of building a data warehouse for a company named ‘OfficeProducts’, including some of the core challenges faced and how they were addressed.

item.title: Part 2. Source Data and ETL Process Explained.
item.description:
View Project on GitHub:

Introduction

In every data warehouse project, a critical step involves understanding the source data and developing an effective ETL process to consolidate that data.

For ‘OfficeProducts’, the source data was primarily gathered from two main files: the Datastream file and the Masterdata file. These two files formed the backbone of the entire data warehouse, feeding the transactional and product-related information necessary for meaningful analysis.

item.title: Part 3. Designing the Snowflake Schema for Efficient Data Analysis.
item.description:
View Project on GitHub:

Introduction

In the world of data warehousing, choosing the right schema is a pivotal decision that determines the efficiency of the entire project.

For ‘OfficeProducts’, we opted for a Snowflake Schema to create a streamlined and high-performing data warehouse.

This schema design allowed us to effectively reduce redundancy, maintain data integrity, and improve overall query performance, making it ideal for deep analysis of sales and product performance data.

item.title: Part 4. Multidimensional Data Analysis: Practical Insights.
item.description:
View Project on GitHub:

Introduction

The ultimate purpose of building a data warehouse is to be able to perform powerful and meaningful analyses to derive actionable business insights.

For the ‘OfficeProducts’ project, we carried out several forms of multidimensional analysis to answer key business questions related to product sales, customer trends, and promotional effectiveness.

In this post, I’ll explore the practical insights gained through these analyses and how tools like ROLLUP and CUBE helped extract deeper trends from the data.

item.title: Part 5. Sales Channels Performance and Promotions: Lessons Learned.
item.description:
View Project on GitHub:

Introduction

Sales channel performance and promotional effectiveness are key aspects that drive business success.

For ‘OfficeProducts’, understanding which channels contributed the most to overall sales and evaluating how promotions influenced sales trends were crucial.

This blog post will walk you through how we analysed sales performance across various channels and promotions using the data warehouse, and the insights we gained from these analyses.

item.title: Part 6. Recommendations for Management and Business Insights.
item.description:
View Project on GitHub:

Introduction

Data-driven insights play a crucial role in helping businesses make informed decisions that align with market dynamics.

For ‘OfficeProducts’, the analysis conducted using the data warehouse provided several valuable insights that translated into actionable recommendations for management.

In this post, I’ll cover key strategies derived from the data, including sales trends, promotion effectiveness, and bundling opportunities, which were designed to help ‘OfficeProducts’ optimise its business performance.

item.title: Data Warehouse Design and Multidimensional Analysis for OfficeProducts
item.description: This section showcases the technical blogs related to this project. Click on each post to learn more about the project components.
